newsitem.title: USA: Democrats say Republican Bosnia charge outrageous.
newsitem.headline: Democrats say Republican Bosnia charge outrageous.

text.p: Congressional Democrats said on Thursday Republicans planned to accuse Clinton administration officials of making possible criminal false statements on U.S. policy on Iran arming the Bosnians in 1994.

"We think it is an outrage," the House of Representatives International Relations Committee Democrats said. They said a Republican-controlled select international relations subcommittee planned to make the charge of possible criminal false statements to Congress at a news conference on Thursday on its investigation of the Iran arms affair.

Administration officials testified at hearings that they decided in 1994 neither to approve nor oppose Iranian weapons for Moslem-led Bosnian government forces because they feared Bosnia would collapse without the arms.
Republicans say the policy was a deception because the administration publicly opposed arms for Bosnia at the time and charge that it allowed Iran to gain influence in Bosnia.

The Democrats, led by Indiana Representative Lee Hamilton, senior Democrat on the full committee, said on Thursday: "We have reviewed the evidence. It is our belief that no laws were broken, no wrongdoing occurred, no covert actions took place, no false statements given, no U.S. interests were harmed."
They said the charge of false statements was based on discrepancies in the testimony of various officials, which they suggested were understandable differences in memories of what happened.

"There were no discrepancies about the essential facts in this case," they said. "A few witnesses disagreed about inconsequential details. That does not in our judgment constitute making false statements to Congress."
